com.esri.mo2.map.prj
Interface Project

All Known Implementing Classes:
LayoutProject, MapProject
public interface Project

This interface represents a generic project file that can be used to save the state of a MapObjects/Java session in a particular serialized format.

Implementations must deal with the serialization of one or more key component types as well as a serialization format (for example a dialect of XML such as ArcXML).

The types that can be serialized are published by the particular implementation - there will usually be one or a small number of types. Outside code must register one or more components with a Project in order to achieve serialization to/from the project file. Usually it will not be necessary to register all components, only those that are needed. Each implementation is expected to provide helper methods for registering known types. These methods will normally be named as getRegisteredXXX() and setRegisteredXXX() where "XXX" is a type that wil be serialized by the Project.

Serialization occurs when the load() or save() method is called. Outside code must set the FileAccess property prior to calling load() or save(). A generic FileAccess is required (rather than just a java.io.File) in order to make it possible to obtain project files from non-File sources, for instance by implementing FileAccess appropriately, it would be possible to load a project from a web site (but probably not to save it there).

Method Summary
 FileAccess getFileAccess()
          Obtains the file access currently being used to read and write the project
 void load()
          Loads the project from file.
 void load(UserCredentialsHandler cHandler)
          Loads the project from file.
 void save()
          Saves the project to file
You can call this method multiple times to save to the same file if desired.

          Sets the file access for future reading/writing the project
 

Method Detail

getFileAccess

public FileAccess getFileAccess()
Obtains the file access currently being used to read and write the project

Returns:
the current FileAccess, or null == no FileAccess has yet been set

setFileAccess

public void setFileAccess(FileAccess fileAccess)
Sets the file access for future reading/writing the project

load

public void load()
          throws IOException
Loads the project from file.
You can call this method multiple times to reload from the same file if desired.

Reads the file and populates the contents of components that have been registered for serialization.

Throws:
IOException - if any problem reading the file

load

public void load(UserCredentialsHandler cHandler)
          throws IOException
Loads the project from file.
You can call this method multiple times to reload from the same file if desired.

Reads the file and populates the contents of components that have been registered for serialization. Using this method you will get an opportunity to type username and password to get access to a restricted resource ( to a restricted ArcIMS map service, for instance).

Throws:
IOException - if any problem reading the file

save

public void save()
          throws IOException
Saves the project to file
You can call this method multiple times to save to the same file if desired.

Serializes all components that have been registered for serialization and writes them to the file.

Throws:
IOException - if any problem writing the file
